page.title: 07The Bakery, Conford.
page.content: Approaching Conford one sees a single storey brick building with no windows and a collection of tiled roofs. The baker and his partner have seen the demise of all small bakeries around but continue to provide bread for discerning people in local villages from these premises. One's glance through the doorway round the back focuses on two large iron doors of the double stack and probably original ovens, now heated independently by oil firing.A large mixer kneader is nearby but there is hand kneading of the dough for loaves, rolls, currant breads, dough cakes and croissants.Wholemeal and rye bread is also made. The baker delivers to some of the local shops, but orders by individuals can be collected from the bakery. The trend to more roughage by eating wholemeal bread was noted.
